IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO BUNKER HILL COMMUNITY COLLEGE AND ITS PROGRAMS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO BUNKER HILL COMMUNITY COLLEGE AND ITS PROGRAMS.
IRS990.Desc: TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS EXPERIENCING UNEXPECTED EDUCATION RELATED FINANCIAL EXPENSES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: PROVIDED FUNDS TO BUNKER HILL COMMUNITY COLLEGE FOR STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: DIRECT SUPPORT OF BUNKER HILL COMMUNITY COLLEGE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BUNKER HILL COMMUNITY COLLEGE FOUNDATION ART COLLECTION CONSISTS OF DONATED SCULPTURES, PAINTINGS, PRINTS, AND PHOTOGRAPHS. THE COLLECTION IS DISPLAYED IN THE MAIN LOBBY, CONFERENCE ROOMS, LOUNGES, AND ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE SUITES OF BUNKER HILL COMMUNITY COLLEGE. THE ART COLLECTION IS MAINLY HELD FOR THE VISUAL ENJOYMENT AND CULTURAL EXPOSURE FOR THE STUDENTS OF BUNKER HILL COMMUNITY COLLEGE AND THE VISITING PUBLIC.

INCOME TAXES THE FOUNDATION IS A NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND IS CLASSIFIED AS AN ORGANIZATION THAT IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION AS DEFINED IN SECTION 509(A) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES GENERALLY ACCEPTED IN THE UNITED STATES REQUIRE AN ENTITY TO ASSESS THE PROBABILITY THAT A TAX POSITION HAS A "MORE LIKELY THAN NOT" (MLTN) SUSTAINABILITY AFTER REVIEW BY TAX AUTHORITIES. IF A TAX POSITION IS DEEMED NOT TO MEET THIS THRESHOLD, ANY UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS AND COSTS ARE ESTIMATED AND RECOGNIZED. TAX RETURNS ARE ROUTINELY OPEN FOR REVIEW BY THE TAX AUTHORITIES FOR THREE YEARS FROM THEIR DUE DATE. IN CERTAIN CIRCUMSTANCES THE STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS MAY REMAIN OPEN INDEFINITELY. AS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ENTITY EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES, THE FOUNDATION MAY, HOWEVER, BE SUBJECT TO TAX ON UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME.

THE FOUNDATION'S INVESTMENT POLICY FOR ENDOWMENT FUNDS IS INTENDED TO PRESERVE CAPITAL TO THE EXTENT POSSIBLE AND PROVIDE A REASONABLY PREDICTABLE STREAM OF REVENUE TO PROVIDE APPROPRIATE FUNDING TO THE PROGRAMS SUPPORTED BY ENDOWMENT FUNDS.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: TO PROVIDE ACADEMIC SUPPORT AND OTHER ACTIVITIES AT BUNKER HILL COMMUNITY COLLEGE, INCLUDING CAPITAL PROJECTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION INSPECTS CHARGES TO ENSURE THAT THEY ARE APPROPRIATE AND ALLOWABLE. THIS INCLUDES CHECKING CLERICAL ACCURACY AND CHECKING COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE AGENCY AND FEDERAL GUIDELINES. THE FOUNDATION ALSO MAKES SURE THAT EXPENSES FIT WITHIN THE REQUIRED CATEGORIES AND BUDGET AMOUNTS. THIS INCLUDES REVIEWING EXPENSE CATEGORIES, REBUDGETING OR TRANSFERRING EXPENSES AS NEEDED, AND DETERMINING IF THE AWARD WILL BE UNDER SPENT AT THE END OF THE BUDGET OR PROJECT PERIOD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF THE FOUNDATION REVIEWS THE 990 AND THEN GIVES A COPY OF THE 990 TO THE FOUNDATION BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS CONSISTENTLY MONITORED AND ENFORCED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
